params: player
You have

Your cell is barely more than a damp, debris littered alcove scooped out of the rock wall of a wide, low passage. [Iron bars|cell_bars] are set into the floor and ceiling of the opening before you to the west.

if.then: A [loose bar|_loose_bar] has been removed, allowing just enough room to squeeze through.

params: The [skeletal remains|cell_skeleton] of an unfortunate former occupant sit against the south wall.

if.then: The head has been detached from the body, and is lying on the floor.
An [oil lamp|_oil_lamp] hung from a peg on the passage wall beyond the bars provides a grim and meager radiance.

params: You reach for the skull, but then decide to refrain from further desecrating this corpse.
The floor is strewn with [rocks, sand, and other debris|rocks_and_debris]. It's clear this cell is not intended to be even basically livable.
The path slopes significantly. To the south: down into darkness and toward the sound of the sea. To the north: up, also into darkness, but also into silence.
One [rock in particular|_rock] catches your eye. Sharp on one end, flat on the other. A fine improvised tool any Neanderthal would be jealous of.
You pick up the [rock.|_rock]
{"var":"cell_got_rock"}
_rock
Grasping the [rock|_rock] by the flat end, you're able to dig away at the soft stone surrounding the bottom of one of the bars. Several minutes and one sore arm later, you pull the bar out of place.
{"var":"cell_opened_bars"}
You wish you could take the oil lamp. Sadly you are a prisoner and there are [iron bars|iron_bars] in the way, remember?
You take the [oil lamp,|_oil_lamp] reasoning that, in a subterranean tunnel, a grim and meager radiance is better than no radiance at all.
_oil_lamp
{"var":"cell_got_lamp"}
room_flooded_passage
You'd have to be as thin as your cell mate there to get through these [bars.|iron_bars]

You're clearly not the first one the cultists have entertained here. The [skeleton's head|skeleton_head] rests awkwardly sunken between his shoulders. His hands are spread open at his sides in an eerie gesture of resignation.
Examining the head more closely, you can clearly see it's been moved and then replaced. Suddenly a glint catches your eye; a [key|_key] can be seen through the ocular cavity.
While a handy weapon in itself, you find it difficult to imagine wielding it effectively in subterranean tunnels. You decide to leave it behind.
Gingerly you reach into the eye socket to take the key, and the head promptly clatters to the floor. With a silent apology to your deceased cell mate you stoop down and remove the key.
{"var":"cell_got_key"}
_key
{"var":"_in_flooded_passage_count"}
Something moves briefly under the surface of the water, and a wave of nausea washes over you.
An oily, indescribable something shoots suddenly from the black pool and drags you into the depths. A shock and tumult of icy water, then dread and darkness.
room_game_over
The steeply sloping tunnel proceeds underwater at this point. The utterly black surface of the [water|_water] reflects the lamplight back like a mirror.

if.then: An abnormally large, [iridescent conch shell|_shell] rests at the edge of the [pool|_water].

params: Your eyes darting periodically to the unsettling mere, you snatch the conch and back away.
_shell
{"var":"flooded_passage_got_shell"}
You reach down and scoop some of the black water into the conch.
_shell
nowhere
_shell_with_water
player
{"var":"_in_flooded_passage_count"}
room_cell
Not without deep sea diving equipment you don't.
Your trusty [rock.|_rock] You feel certain this thing will come in handy.

things.name: _key
things.description: [a brass key you got from a skeleton's head|_key]

things.name: _shell_with_water
things.description: [an iridescent conch shell filled with icy subterranean water|_shell_with_water]
